messages.content:
imagine the commentators are Joe Rogan and DC and Anik, please pretend you are them and give very very detailed commentary (eg. Joe: he’s hurt, Rodriguez lands a big right hand!)with fight descriptions (eg. Alvarez counters with a spinning elbow that knocks Evans out cold, followed by something like “Anik: Joel Alvarez BY KNOCKOUT, DO YOU BELIEVE IT!”), fights can end by KO, TKO, submission or decision, if decision announce the score of each judge, eg. (xxx score it 48-47 Oliveira, xxx scores it 48-47 Chandler, and xxx scores it 48-47 for the winner by split decision… Charles “Do Bronx” Oliveira!)
Rounds of fight are determined by the bracket after the fights, eg Oliveira vs Makhachev (5) should be 5 round
give the judges a name
put “Round x:” before each round
commentary needs to be long, remember each round is 5 minutes
Each round need at least 10 lines of commentary
Don’t tell me the scoring at the end of rounds, reveal scores only at the end if the fight went to a decision

Event fight 1: Alex Pereira vs Marvin Vettori (3)

Joe Rogan: "Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the octagon! This is going to be one hell of a fight! Alex Pereira, the kickboxing superstar, against Marvin Vettori, the Italian dream! Both men are known for their striking abilities, but Vettori has the edge when it comes to grappling. Let's see if Pereira can keep it standing!"

Round 1:
DC: "Here we go, Pereira immediately throws out some low kicks! Vettori rushing in looking for a takedown, but Pereira defends well and they break apart. Pereira with some slick movement, avoiding Vettori's strikes. Oh, big right hand from Pereira that rocks Vettori! He's hurt and Pereira pounces with some heavy shots."

Joe Rogan: "Vettori trying to stay composed and recover, but Pereira is all over him with punches and kicks to the legs. Vettori manages to get a hold of Pereira and take him down though, great move by the Italian. He's looking to pass guard now."

DC: "Pereira doing everything he can to keep Vettori from advancing, but Vettori is methodical in his ground-and-pound. He's looking for an opening to sink in a submission."

Joe Rogan: "Pereira trying to scramble and get back to his feet, but Vettori holds him down until the end of the round. That was a tough round for Pereira, but he did land some heavy shots earlier."

Round 2:
DC: "Pereira coming out aggressive again in the second round, throwing punches and kicks. Vettori seems to be waiting for an opportunity to take him down again. Both fighters exchanging strikes in the center of the octagon."

Joe Rogan: "Vettori with a nice combination that lands! Pereira answers back with a knee, but Vettori shoots in and takes Pereira down again. He's in side control."

DC: "Great position for Vettori to work from. Pereira needs to get his hips out and create some space. Vettori is looking for another submission attempt it seems."

Joe Rogan: "Pereira doing a good job defending so far, but Vettori is relentless with his attacks. Pereira trying to spin out but Vettori keeps him pinned to the ground."

Round 3:
DC: "Third and final round! Pereira needs to do something big here to win this fight."

Joe Rogan: "Pereira coming out with some explosive kicks, trying to keep Vettori at bay. Vettori looking for another takedown, but Pereira is doing a great job stuffing his attempts."

DC: "Pereira has done a good job keeping this fight standing, but he needs to do something more significant to win this round. The judges are watching closely."

Joe Rogan: "Vettori with a strong jab that lands and follows it up with a takedown attempt. Pereira stuffs it again! He's really showing his takedown defense here tonight."

DC: "Time is running out for Vettori, he needs to throw everything he's got left. Pereira is circling out and avoiding any significant strikes that Vettori is throwing."

Joe Rogan: "That's the end of the fight! Both fighters giving it their all. What a battle!"

Anik: "Ladies and gentlemen, after three rounds we go to the judges' scorecards. Judge one scores it 29-28 Pereira, judge two scores it 29-28 Vettori, and judge three scores it 29-28 for the winner by split decision, Marvin Vettori!"
In post fight interview, Vettori calls out Adesanya

Joe Rogan: "Marvin Vettori, fantastic performance out there! You were able to control the fight with your grappling, landing takedowns and ground-and-pound. What's going through your mind right now?"

Marvin Vettori: "I'm feeling great, Joe! I knew Pereira was a tough opponent, but I had a solid game plan and was able to execute it. But now, I want to call out the champ!"

DC: "Oh, he's talking about Israel Adesanya! That's a bold move, but Vettori thinks he's ready for that challenge."

Joe Rogan: "You want a rematch with Adesanya after falling short in your first fight?"

Marvin Vettori: "Absolutely, Joe! The first fight was close, and I know I can beat him. I've been improving my grappling, and Adesanya has never faced anyone like me. I want that rematch, I'm coming for the belt!" 

DC: "Wow, strong words from Vettori! If he continues to perform like he did tonight, he might just get that rematch with Adesanya."

Joe Rogan: "Well, we'll have to see how the rankings shake out after tonight's fights. But for now, congratulations on a great win, Marvin Vettori!"

Joe Rogan: "Up next, we have a highly anticipated bout between Robert Whittaker and Paulo Costa. Two heavy hitters with a ton of knockout power. The winner of this fight could be next in line for a title shot."

DC: "Whittaker had an incredible fight against Kelvin Gastelum in his last outing. He's not only a striker, but a well-rounded fighter. Costa is looking to get back on track after his loss to Adesanya in his last fight."

Round 1:
Joe Rogan: "And we're off! Whittaker starts things off with a couple of feints, testing Costa's reactions. Costa not backing down though, throwing some heavy punches."

DC: "Both guys throwing heavy heat in the first minute! Whittaker using his technical striking, but Costa is swinging for the fences."

Joe Rogan: "Whittaker with some leg kicks that are starting to wear on Costa. Costa trying to close the distance and land some big shots."

DC: "Whittaker doing a great job of keeping Costa at bay with his jab and using his movement to avoid any significant strikes."

Round 2:
Joe Rogan: "Round two, and Whittaker comes out strong. He's starting to find his range, landing some stiff jabs."

DC: "Costa looks a bit slower now, those leg kicks from Whittaker taking a toll on him. He needs to do something to turn this around."

Joe Rogan: "Whittaker with a nice head kick that Costa just barely evades. Costa needs to start landing some significant shots, or he's going to get picked apart."

DC: "Whittaker with a takedown attempt that Costa defends well. Costa throws a leg kick of his own, but Whittaker fires back with a combination."

Round 3:
Joe Rogan: "Third and final round, and Costa needs to do something big here to win this fight."

DC: "Whittaker is picking him apart with his striking, using his movement and footwork to avoid any significant shots from Costa."

Joe Rogan: "Whittaker looking very comfortable out there, Costa seems to be slowing down. He's having trouble getting his offense going."

DC: "Whittaker with a beautiful right hand that lands flush on Costa's chin! He's in trouble, Joe!"

Joe Rogan: "Whittaker is all over him now, pouring on the strikes! Costa is trying to defend, but he's just getting overwhelmed!"

Anik: "And that's the end of the fight! What a performance by Robert Whittaker!"

Joe Rogan: "Whittaker really turned it on in that third round, landing some significant strikes and really putting the pressure on Costa. Let's wait for the judges' decision."

Anik: "Ladies and gentlemen, after three rounds, we go to the judges' scorecards. Judge one scores it 30-27 for Whittaker, judge two scores it 29-28 for Costa, and judge three scores it 30-27 for the winner by split decision...Robert Whittaker!"

DC: "Wow, a split decision! One judge gave Costa a round, but it wasn't enough. Whittaker did a great job of imposing his game plan and coming out with the win."

Joe Rogan: "No doubt about it, Whittaker looked phenomenal out there. Costa gave him a tough fight, but in the end, Whittaker was just too much for him."
Fight 3: Mereno vs Kara France (5) for interim flyweight belt

Joe Rogan: "And now, the moment we've all been waiting for! An interim flyweight championship bout between Brandon Mereno and Kai Kara France. This is going to be an explosive fight, folks!"

DC: "Both of these fighters have been on a tear, and now they have the chance to become a champion. Mereno is known for his grappling, while Kara France is a striker. This is going to be a battle of styles."

Round 1:
Joe Rogan: "Here we go! Mereno starts off with a leg kick that Kara France just barely checks. Kara France with some nice jabs."

DC: "Mereno is looking to close the distance and take Kara France down. Kara France is doing a good job of keeping him at bay so far."

Joe Rogan: "Mereno with a nice left hook that lands! Kara France backs up for a second, but he's coming right back with some strong punches of his own."

DC: "Kara France with a quick combination that rocks Mereno. He's in trouble, Joe!"

Joe Rogan: "Mereno is able to clinch with Kara France and bring the fight to the ground. He's looking for a submission attempt."

Round 2:
Joe Rogan: "Mereno starts off the second round with another leg kick. Kara France trying to keep his distance and land some heavy punches."

DC: "Mereno with another takedown attempt, but Kara France is defending well. He's showing some really good takedown defense tonight."

Joe Rogan: "Mereno needs to get this fight to the ground if he wants to take control. Kara France is doing a great job of keeping it standing and using his striking."

DC: "Kara France with some heavy left hooks that land! Mereno is starting to slow down, this might be the opening Kara France needs."

Round 3:
Joe Rogan: "Third round, and this fight is still up for grabs. Mereno needs to get a takedown if he wants to win, but Kara France is looking to keep it standing."

DC: "Kara France is showing off his striking skills now, throwing some nice combinations and leg kicks. Mereno is having a hard time getting inside."

Joe Rogan: "Mereno with a takedown attempt that Kara France defends, but he's getting pushed up against the cage. Mereno is looking for a trip takedown."

DC: "Kara France is trying to fight off the takedown, but Mereno is relentless. He gets him down with a beautiful trip!"

Round 4:
Joe Rogan: "Fourth round and this fight is still razor-thin. Mereno was able to get a takedown in the third, can he do it again?"

DC: "Kara France is really using his striking now, landing some significant shots to the body and head. Mereno needs to do something to turn this around."

Joe Rogan: "Mereno needs to get this fight to the ground if he wants to win this round. Kara France is showing great takedown defense."

DC: "Kara France with a huge right hand that lands! Mereno is hurt, he's in trouble!"

Joe Rogan: "Mereno is trying to defend himself, but Kara France is all over him with punches and kicks. Mereno is in trouble!"

Anik: "And that's the end of the fourth round! Mereno survived that scare, but Kara France is looking very strong right now."

Round 5:
Joe Rogan: "Fifth and final round! Mereno needs a takedown or a finish to win this fight."

DC: "Kara France is really picking his shots now, landing some nice jabs and leg kicks. Mereno needs to do something big here."

Joe Rogan: "Mereno with a takedown attempt that Kara France defends. He's doing a great job of keeping this fight standing."

DC: "Kara France is really showing off his striking now, landing some significant shots to the head and body. Mereno is trying to hang on."

Joe Rogan: "Kara France is really turning it on in the final seconds of this fight. Mereno needs a miracle if he wants to win."

Anik: "And that's the end of the fight! What a battle between these two fighters!"

DC: "That was an incredible fight, Joe! Both fighters gave it their all, but the judges will have to decide the winner."

Joe Rogan: "Let's wait for the judges' decision."

Anik: "Ladies and gentlemen, after five rounds we go to the judges' scorecards. Judge one scores it 48-47 for Mereno, judge two scores it 48-47 for Kara France, and judge three scores it 48-47 for the winner by split decision and new interim flyweight champion... Kai Kara France!"

DC: "Wow, what a close fight. Kara France really turned it on in the later rounds, using his striking to keep Mereno at bay. He definitely deserved the win."

Joe Rogan: "An incredible win for Kara France, that was a great performance. Mereno gave it his all, but Kara France's striking was just too much for him."
Fight 4 (Co main): Amanda Nunes vs Valentina Shevchenko (5), this is their third meeting, Shevchenko is moving up to challenge for female's bantamweight belt

Joe Rogan: "And now, the co-main event of the evening! We have a highly anticipated rematch between two of the greatest female fighters of all time: Amanda Nunes and Valentina Shevchenko. This is a fight we've all been waiting for!"

DC: "These two have faced each other twice before, and both fights were extremely close. Shevchenko is moving up from flyweight to challenge Nunes for her bantamweight belt, so this is a big test for her."

Round 1:
Joe Rogan: "Here we go! Nunes starts off with a leg kick that lands. Shevchenko lands a strong right hand in response."

DC: "Both of these fighters are so explosive, Joe. They can end the fight at any moment."

Joe Rogan: "Nunes with a nice punch combination that lands. Shevchenko looking to counter."

DC: "Shevchenko with a quick jab that lands. Nunes is trying to close the distance and get inside."

Round 2:
Joe Rogan: "Second round, and both fighters seem to have found their range. Nunes with another leg kick that lands."

DC: "Shevchenko is really using her movement to avoid any significant strikes from Nunes. She's waiting for Nunes to make a mistake."

Joe Rogan: "Nunes with a nice right hand that lands! Shevchenko is able to evade any follow-up strikes though."

DC: "Shevchenko with a strong body kick that lands. Nunes is trying to get inside, but Shevchenko is doing a good job of keeping her at bay."

Round 3:
Joe Rogan: "Third round, and this fight is still very close. It's going to be a battle of who can impose their game plan."

DC: "Nunes is starting to use her wrestling now, taking Shevchenko down to the ground. Shevchenko is doing a good job of defending though, looking for an opportunity to get back up."

Joe Rogan: "Nunes looking to pass guard, but Shevchenko is using her jiu-jitsu skills to keep her from doing any damage."

DC: "Nunes with a strong ground-and-pound, landing some significant strikes to the body and head. Shevchenko needs to do something to get out of this position."

Round 4:
Joe Rogan: "Fourth round, and Nunes seems to have taken control of this fight with her ground-and-pound in the last round."

DC: "Shevchenko is starting to use her striking more now, closing the distance and landing some nice shots."

Joe Rogan: "Nunes is looking for another takedown, but Shevchenko is using her movement to avoid any attempts."

DC: "Shevchenko with a head kick that lands! Nunes is hurt, she's in trouble!"

Joe Rogan: "Nunes is trying to defend herself, but Shevchenko is all over her with punches and kicks. Nunes is in trouble!"

Round 5:
Joe Rogan: "Fifth and final round, and Shevchenko seems to have the momentum after that incredible knockdown in the last round."

DC: "Nunes needs to do something big here if she wants to keep her belt. Shevchenko is using her movement and timing to avoid any significant strikes."

Joe Rogan: "Nunes with a takedown attempt that Shevchenko defends. She's back up to her feet."

DC: "Shevchenko with a left hook that lands! Nunes is hurt again, she's in trouble!"

Joe Rogan: "Nunes is trying to defend herself, but Shevchenko is all over her with punches and kicks. Nunes is in trouble!"

Anik: "And that's the end of the fight! What an incredible performance by both fighters!"

DC: "Wow, what a fight. Shevchenko really turned it on in the later rounds, showing off her striking skills and almost finishing Nunes."

Joe Rogan: "Let's wait for the judges' decision, this one could go either way."

Anik: "Ladies and gentlemen, after five rounds we go
